CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Inadmissible under Art. 6-1 with regard to criminal proceedings;Inadmissible with regard to the second applicant;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , PERSON and PERSON , a married couple , are NORP nationals . They were both born in DATE and live in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE W.Ł. ( “ the petitioner ” ) filed an application with ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) , seeking a decision declaring that she had acquired a title to certain real property . The first applicant was one of the parties to the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave a decision . It declared that GPE and her husband GPE had acquired the title to the property which consisted of CARDINAL plots of land . The first applicant appealed against that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( PERSON ) set aside the first - instance decision and remitted the case in respect of CARDINAL of the plots . It dismissed the remainder of the first applicant ’s appeal .
CARDINAL . The hearing listed for DATE was adjourned since the first applicant had been improperly summoned .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing . The first applicant was not present . At the next hearing , held on DATE , the court stayed the proceedings due to the death of GPE , one of the participants in the proceedings . On DATE the court held hearing and resumed the proceedings . The hearing fixed for DATE was adjourned at the petitioner ’s request . The trial court held further hearings on DATE , DATE , and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing . The first applicant failed to appear . The next hearing took place on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave a decision ( postanowienie ) . It held that GPE and GPE had acquired the title to the property in question .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant asked for leave to file an appeal out of time . He claimed that he had been sick and he had not been able to lodge an appeal against the final decision within the prescribed time limit .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing in the appeal proceedings . At a further hearing held on DATE , ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal of DATE .

CARDINAL . Later , on an unknown date , the first applicant asked the Minister of Justice for leave to file a cassation appeal with ORG ( Sąd Najwyższy ) against the above - mentioned decisions of ORG . On DATE the Minister of ORG lodged a cassation appeal on the first applicant ’s behalf .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decisions of ORG of DATE and CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case . It found that ORG had not summoned all the parties to the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing . It ordered GPE to produce certain documents . On DATE the court stayed the proceedings because ORG had failed to comply with that order . On DATE the ORG dismissed the first applicant ’s appeal against that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the first applicant ’s further appeal against the decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE the applicants informed the ORG that the proceedings are still pending before ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicants requested ORG ) to institute criminal proceedings against PERSON and PERSON , complaining that the latter had destroyed their house and stolen their trees . On DATE ORG discontinued the investigation against the alleged culprits . On DATE ORG ) upheld this decision .

CARDINAL . In DATE , following the ORG complaint to the Minister of ORG , ORG reopened the investigation . On DATE ORG again discontinued the investigation considering that no criminal offence had been committed . The applicants subsequently complained to the Minister of ORG about that decision .
